danaus

Enum Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Direction>
      • danaus.Direction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Direction>

    public enum Direction
extends java.lang.Enum<Direction>
    An instance is one of 8 cardinal directions. Each direction contains information on its relative position to a tile in an array. For example, consider tile tiles[tRow][tCol]. The tile to its north is tile tiles[tRow + NORTH.dRow][tCol + NORTH.dColumn].
    Modular arithmetic fixes instances in which tiles are on the edge of a map.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int dCol
      The change in the column needed to reach a tile in the given direction.
      int dRow
      The change in the row needed to reach a tile in the given direction.

        public static Direction valueOf(java.lang.String name)

      • parseDirection

        public static Direction parseDirection(java.lang.String direction)
        Return the Direction corresponding to direction. Throw a DirectionFormatException if direction is not one of "n", "ne", "e", "se", "s", "sw", "w", "nw" (upper or lower case).
        Parameters:
        direction - String representation of a direction. e.g. "N"
        Returns:
        A direction object corresponding to String direction.
        Throws:
        DirectionFormatException
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • opposite

        public static Direction opposite(Direction direction)
        Return the direction opposite direction d. Throw an IllegalArgumentException if d is not one of the 8 Direction objects (which should not happen!).
